content:
I've really enjoyed the episodes that focus on Princess Margaret's storyline. I think her character adds a lot of depth to the show, and her struggles with her role in the royal family are really relatable. I've also loved the episodes that explore the relationship between the Queen and her sister, Princess Margaret. Their bond is so complex and multifaceted, and I think it's really interesting to see how they navigate their differences while still maintaining their sisterly love.

But what I think has really stood out to me so far is the way the show portrays the Queen's growth and development as a monarch. It's clear that she's still learning and growing into her role, and I think that's really admirable. I've loved watching her navigate the challenges of being a female leader in a male-dominated world, and seeing how she finds ways to assert her authority while still being compassionate and empathetic.
